(b) James would spend quality time with his child whenever possible so that he could maintain their close relationship and ensure his child felt loved and supported.
1.target_answer: (a) James would spend quality time with his child whenever possible

(a) James would spend quality time with his child whenever possible.
(b) James would spend quality time with his child whenever possible so that he could maintain their close relationship and ensure his child felt loved and supported.

Statement (a) simply states that James would spend quality time with his child whenever possible. This is a straightforward statement that is consistent with the description of James as a caring father.

Statement (b) adds additional information to statement (a), specifying the reasons why James would spend quality time with his child. While this additional information is plausible and consistent with the description of James, it does not increase the probability of the original statement.

In fact, according to the conjunction rule in probability theory, the probability of two events occurring together (the conjunction) is always less than or equal to the probability of either event occurring alone.

Therefore, I conclude that:
